messages.subject: Re: Delighted!
messages.msgSnippet: OOPS! Wrong List-- sorry.  I m dealing with an acute case of nursing brain. Tami
messages.messageBody:
OOPS!
Wrong List-- sorry. I'm dealing with an acute case of nursing brain.
Tami



--- In UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com, "Tami Jordan"
<atj090@g...> wrote:
>
> >>>I have picked him up and ***delighted him away*** from potential
> danger effectively though. So this too is an option. But dragging him
> away doesn't work for us.<<<
>
> I just want to say that I love how this sounds! I'm forever telling
> dh "just distract him with something", when he (dh) might otherwise
> prefer to take some coercive action in response to somthing the
> children do. This sounds SO much better, and by sounding better,
> feels better! Kinda like Sandra's post awhile back about language
> and
> how it shapes our attitudes. Cool!
> Tami

messages.subject: Delighted!
messages.msgSnippet: ... danger effectively though. So this too is an option. But dragging him away doesn t work for us.
messages.messageBody:
>>>I have picked him up and ***delighted him away*** from potential
danger effectively though. So this too is an option. But dragging him
away doesn't work for us.<<<

I just want to say that I love how this sounds! I'm forever telling
dh "just distract him with something", when he (dh) might otherwise
prefer to take some coercive action in response to somthing the
children do. This sounds SO much better, and by sounding better,
feels better! Kinda like Sandra's post awhile back about language
and
how it shapes our attitudes. Cool!
Tami
